column1: Extracting Synonymous Gene and Protein Terms from Biomedical Literature
column2: Hong Yu; Eugene Agichtein
column3: ABSTRACT Genes and proteins are often associated with multiple names; and more namesare added as new functional or structural information is discovered. Because authors oftenalternate between these synonyms; information retrieval and extraction benefits fromidentifying these synonymous names. We have compared four different approaches forextracting synonyms from text; based on unsupervised; semi-supervised; and supervisedmachine-learning techniques; as well as a system incorporating hand-crafted extractionrules and heuristics. We evaluated these over a collection of more than 50;000 biological full-text biological journal articles. Availability: The extracted (and evaluated) synonymous geneor protein name pairs are available at http://synonyms. cs. columbia. edu/
